meanings.definition: A staple food in Zimbabwe made from maize meal.
meanings.sent1: In Zimbabwe, many people enjoy eating sadza with their meals.
meanings.sent2: My family always has sadza for dinner because it is a traditional dish.
meanings.sent3: At the family gathering, everyone fought over the last piece of sadza.
meanings.sent4: The warm aroma of sadza filled the kitchen, reminding me of home.
meanings.sent5: The golden brown sadza looked like a fluffy cloud on my plate.

meanings.definition: To eat sadza with a stew.
meanings.sent1: I love to scoop up the stew with sadza for a delicious bite.
meanings.sent2: When I visit Zimbabwe, I always make sure to sadza with stew.
meanings.sent3: My friend joked that he could sadza with stew faster than anyone else.
meanings.sent4: She savored each bite as if the sadza and stew were a gourmet meal.
meanings.sent5: The flavors of the stew and sadza combined perfectly in my mouth.

meanings.sent1: The smell of the kitchen indicated that someone was busy with the sadza.
meanings.sent2: The art of making sadza requires patience and skill.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best sadza maker in the village was fierce.
meanings.sent4: The sound of laughter filled the air as the women gathered to prepare the sadza.
meanings.sent5: The secret to perfect sadza lies in the precise timing of stirring and cooking.

meanings.sent1: The waiter brought a steaming plate of sadza to our table.
meanings.sent2: The children eagerly reached for the last piece of sadza on the plate.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing plate of sadza made everyone's mouth water.
meanings.sent4: The simple plate of sadza held memories of family gatherings and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The colorful vegetables on the side complemented the plain plate of sadza perfectly.
